channel.title: The CritterCast: Pet Care Info and Advice from Critterology.com
channel.itunes:subtitle: More about pets can be found at Critterology.com
channel.itunes:author: Critterology.com
channel.itunes:summary: The CritterCast features behavioral and medical advice for pet owners--and pets. Dogs, cats, pocket pets, reptiles, birds, fish, horses, cows, pigs, even wildlife--all are fair game for the CritterCast!
channel.description: The CritterCast features behavioral and medical advice for pet owners and pet lovers. Dogs, cats, hamsters, gerbils, ferrets, iguanas, snakes, turtles, reptiles, birds, fish, horses, cows, pigs, even wildlife--all are fair game for the CritterCast!

item.title: Q&A: Itchy Dogs, Allergy Testing, and is Seborrhea Contagious?
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr. Susan Muller Esneault discusses different possible causes for itchy dogs, including Seasonal Allergies, Food Allergies, and Seborrhea. These calls were originally recorded for MedCall on WAAY-31 TV in Huntsville, Alabama.
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Susan Muller Esneault discusses different possible causes for itchy dogs, including Seasonal Allergies, Food Allergies, and Seborrhea. These calls were originally recorded for MedCall on WAAY-31 TV in Huntsville, Alabama.
item.itunes:keywords: itch itchy scratch seborrhea flea allergy dog testing contagious

item.title: Chocolate Toxicosis
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Think giving your pet chocolate is a suitable treat? Unfortunately, chocolate is toxic in dogs and many other species of animals.
item.itunes:summary: Think giving your pet chocolate is a suitable treat? Unfortunately, chocolate is toxic in dogs and many other species of animals.
item.itunes:keywords: dogs cats livestock cocoa caffeine theobromine poison toxic

item.title: Marijuana Toxicity In Pets
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: There's been plenty of debate about whether marijuana is harmful to humans, but it is definitely harmful to your pet.
item.itunes:summary: There's been plenty of debate about whether marijuana is harmful to humans, but it is definitely harmful to your pet.
item.itunes:keywords: marijuana pot smoke oral dogs cats ingest

item.title: Caring for a Pet Potbellied Pig
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Potbellied pigs are sweet-natured, intelligent, active and adorable. As a pet, however, they can be extremely demanding.
item.itunes:summary: Potbellied pigs are sweet-natured, intelligent, active and adorable. As a pet, however, they can be extremely demanding.
item.itunes:keywords: potbellied pigs hogs adopt feed care

item.title: Examine Your Horse Before You Buy
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Buying a horse is a serious investment. Before you make any decisions, it’s wise to have a veterinarian who specializes in horses perform a prepurchase evaluation on the horse you’re interested in.
item.itunes:summary: Buying a horse is a serious investment. Before you make any decisions, it’s wise to have a veterinarian who specializes in horses perform a prepurchase evaluation on the horse you’re interested in.
item.itunes:keywords: equine lameness eia sale prepurchase physical cem mare stallion gelding

item.title: The Number One Reason Pets are Brought to Shelters
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: A nationwide study of animal control facilities performed in 2000 reported that 28% of cats and 40% of dogs were surrendered due to one or more behavior problems. But that number is probably much higher. If we take some simple steps to prevent problems with our own pets, this figure is likely to decrease greatly.
item.itunes:summary: A nationwide study of animal control facilities performed in 2000 reported that 28% of cats and 40% of dogs were surrendered due to one or more behavior problems. But that number is probably much higher. If we take some simple steps to prevent problems with our own pets, this figure is likely to decrease greatly.
item.itunes:keywords: animal shelter dogs cats give up adopt adoption elimination behavior inappropriate

item.title: Burns in Reptiles
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: The most common type of burns seen in captive reptiles are thermal and are usually attributed to an abnormally hot heat source, one from which the animal cannot escape. Chemical burns may also occur, typically from cleaning solutions used to sanitize the enclosure of a captive reptile.
item.itunes:summary: The most common type of burns seen in captive reptiles are thermal and are usually attributed to an abnormally hot heat source, one from which the animal cannot escape. Chemical burns may also occur, typically from cleaning solutions used to sanitize the enclosure of a captive reptile.
item.itunes:keywords: reptile iguana snake lizard burn thermal heat enclosure terrarium chemical cleaning

item.title: The 2008 Presidential Candidates--And Their Pets
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: What does a person’s pets say about them? If you can figure anything out about someone by the pets they keep, you may want to take a look at the pets of all the presidential candidates. It may help you decide on your way to the ballot box!
item.itunes:summary: What does a person’s pets say about them? If you can figure anything out about someone by the pets they keep, you may want to take a look at the pets of all the presidential candidates. It may help you decide on your way to the ballot box!
item.itunes:keywords: presidents, america, united, states, pets, millie, bush, mccain, obama, clinton, romney, huckabee, edwards, guiliani

item.title: Cats--Outdoor Life vs. Indoor Safety
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: While many cat owners consider their pets outside cats, the fact is that cats kept indoors are much safer and healthier than their outdoor counterparts. Fighting, diseases, and parasites are among the dangers that outdoor cats may face.
item.itunes:summary: While many cat owners consider their pets outside cats, the fact is that cats kept indoors are much safer and healthier than their outdoor counterparts. Fighting, diseases, and parasites are among the dangers that outdoor cats may face.
item.itunes:keywords: cats, kittens, kitty, outdoors, fighting, heartworms

item.title: Holiday Hazards for Your Pets
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: The holidays are a joyous time for friends and socializing. We decorate our households, fix elaborate meals, bring trees and special plants into our homes, and yet we pay little attention to what effect these new habits will have on our furred and feathered friends.
item.itunes:summary: The holidays are a joyous time for friends and socializing. We decorate our households, fix elaborate meals, bring trees and special plants into our homes, and yet we pay little attention to what effect these new habits will have on our furred and feathered friends.
item.itunes:keywords: holiday, christmas, poisonous, ingest, poultry, decoration

item.title: Holiday Special: Poinsettias and Mistletoe
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Pretty plants can be poisonous to pets! Today, how toxic are poinsettias? Should you be worried about pets getting "too friendly" with your mistletoe? For more detailed versions of these articles, please visit our website at http://www.critterology.com.
item.itunes:summary: Pretty plants can be poisonous to pets! Today, how toxic are poinsettias? Should you be worried about pets getting "too friendly" with your mistletoe? For more detailed versions of these articles, please visit our website at http://www.critterology.com.
item.itunes:keywords: holiday, christmas, poisonous, ingest, poinsettia, mistletoe, toxin

item.title: Caring for Orphaned Baby Birds
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: What should you do when you find a lost hatchling? Raising baby birds can be a heartwarming experience, and most do well when you follow some basic rules. For more, please visit www.critterology.com.
item.itunes:summary: What should you do when you find a lost hatchling? Raising baby birds can be a heartwarming experience, and most do well when you follow some basic rules. For more, please visit www.critterology.com.
item.itunes:keywords: birds, hatchlings, orphans, nest, found, lost

item.title: Canine Separation Anxiety
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Your dog is a family-oriented pack animal. Stress associated with isolation from your family can lead to a syndrome described as Separation Anxiety. Symptoms include barking, whining, whimpering, trembling, destructive behavior such as chewing or digging, house soiling, salivation, vomiting, diarrhea, anorexia and depression. For more, please visit Critterology.com.
item.itunes:summary: Your dog is a family-oriented pack animal. Stress associated with isolation from your family can lead to a syndrome described as Separation Anxiety. Symptoms include barking, whining, whimpering, trembling, destructive behavior such as chewing or digging, house soiling, salivation, vomiting, diarrhea, anorexia and depression. For more, please visit Critterology.com.
item.itunes:keywords: anxiety, symptoms, barking, scratching, whining, family

item.title: Are all white-haired animals albinos?
item.itunes:author: Critterology.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Albinism--the lack of pigment melanin in the skin, hair and eyes--can be associated with skin cancer, deafness, nervous disorders, and other problems. For more, please visit Critterology.com.
item.itunes:summary: Albinism--the lack of pigment melanin in the skin, hair and eyes--can be associated with skin cancer, deafness, nervous disorders, and other problems. For more, please visit Critterology.com.
item.itunes:keywords: albino, melanin, skin, hair, white, horse, dog, cat, ferret, cow, pig
